ygData.subject: Re: [RE: Ok, complaint time!]
ygData.msgSnippet: I too have had ridiculous lag.  My lag-o-meter doesn t show it but i sure can feel it. Especiallyl when running.  I start to stutter and stagger and slow down
ygData.messageBody:
I too have had ridiculous lag. My lag-o-meter doesn't
show it but i sure can feel it. Especiallyl when
running. I start to stutter and stagger and slow down
to almost a crawl. This has been affecting not only
myself, but my party members also. It's lead to more
deaths than I can imagine. BAH

Adira SoulSaver
Bandaid of Tunare
Rodcet Nife Server

--- Shanna <Jacecar@...> wrote:
> From: Shanna <Jacecar@...>
>
> Kevin Dailey <Kevin_Dailey@...> wrote:
> > From: Kevin Dailey <Kevin_Dailey@...>
> >
> > Ok, all this IPX talk, and we've forgotten the
> original post--I too am
> > getting strange lag at times, which has never
> happened before. And my
> > meter is not showing any lag at all. I find it
> disconcerting, to say the
> > least. Rest assured, I have a very fast
> computer/graphics setup, and a
> > fast modem. I recently downloaded a big 28 meg
> SBLive! upgrade...I
> > wonder if that crap has affected my gameplay
> somehow...I hate some of
> > those SBLive! components.
> >
> > Saidinn
>
> I used to zone fast -- very fast, and then over time
> it dropped down to where
> I seem to zone slowly...
>
> About 2 weeks ago, I started getting disconnected
> when I zone. Not just once,
> but nearly everytime. I wrote EQ tech support, but
> solved the problem on my
> own without them.
>
> With all of the screenshots I had taken and never
> cleaned up, as well as the
> email that had been piling up and never read (all
> those distribution lists I
> used to pay attention to before I became an EQ
> Addict), my harddrive partition
> was getting full, and was extremely fragmented.
>
> I cleaned up the email, removed 90% of the
> screenshots, defraged, and my
> problems went away.
>
> Yes, I still get disconnected sometimes due to
> network problems (lag, etc.)
> but tracert will tell me if it's local, in-route, or
> on the EQ end, so I know
> when to panic or not. And the client problems are
> gone after a small amount
> of sys maintenance.
>
> >Shanna on Rallos
>
>
>
